result.execSummary:
The defendant Theofanis Spyropoulos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF726, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to DNA surcharge and Court Costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with any family member.
Participate in parenting class.
Write letter of apology to his son and to Officer Morris.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theofanis Spyropoulos

defendant.name: Spyropoulos, Theofanis
defendant.address: 13820 W Prospect Dr, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Theofanis  Spyropoulos in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

Count #2:

60 DAYS JAIL, CONSECUTIVE TO 15CF726,

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No violent contact with any family member:  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Participate in a parenting class.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*No possession of any weapons.
*Write letter of apology to Officer Morris and to his child.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 apply cash bail;

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 apply cash bail;

Defendant Theofanis  Spyropoulos in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Chernin requests the case be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Theofanis  Spyropoulos in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery and requests to discuss this matter with the ADA assigned. Court grants request and will give another date. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Theofanis Spyropoulos in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Theofanis Spyropoulos in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with family members.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Theofanis Spyropoulos in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Public Defender Intern Arial Rosenberg appears as a friend of the court.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
